intro: Descurainia rydbergii var. eglandulosa, commonly known as the glandless tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered with fine hairs. The small yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in the spring, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
